summary:
The 400 meters is a track and field race, one lap around a standard track. Runners start in different positions and stay in their lanes. It's been an Olympic event since 1896 for men and 1964 for women.

Athletes use starting blocks to get a powerful start. The current men's world record is 43.03 seconds, held by Wayde van Niekerk. For women, Marita Koch's record is 47.60 seconds.

Some runners, like Michael Johnson and Marie-José Pérec, have won both the 200m and 400m Olympic titles, a rare achievement.
title: 400 metres
